div.p: Part of my Army service I went all over Northern Ireland and places like that and I was in the Falklands for the war and ended up getting
injured down there and lost bits of my right leg and stuff; when I done my leg other people got killed in the incident and stuff
and I ended up in hospital in Woolwich and I had gangrene in my leg and was really down and fed up with life and what have you
I was going to lose my leg and sport was a massive thing to me, I was 21 years old and I thought “What am I going to do with my life?
They’re going to kick me out of the army it’s everything this job to me” and I thought “no I am going to get fit again”
I’ll never, ever forget this as long as I live, I was all fed up and depressed and the nurses at Woolwich, I’d just come out of traction
and I was in a wheelchair and they took me up to Ward 14, I’ll never forget it, Ward 14 which is a burns unit at the hospital
and there was a guy in there you might have heard of him, you might not, he was a guy called Simon Weston
who was there covered in flamazine and burnt to a crisp and you know I was having a chat with him and stuff and I thought
to myself there’s nothing wrong with you... (Me).
